column2: EKS Pod Identity attaches tags like eks-cluster-arn, eks-cluster-name, kubernetes-namespace, kubernetes-service-account, kubernetes-pod-name, and kubernetes-pod-uid to the temporary credentials of each pod.
A policy that allows the s3:GetObject action if the object is tagged with the name of the EKS cluster is provided in the document.
All of the session tags added by EKS Pod Identity are transitive, meaning the tag keys and values are passed to any AssumeRole actions that your workloads use to switch roles into another account.

column1: eks custom tags for pod identity
column2: EKS Pod Identity can't add additional custom tags to the AssumeRole action that it performs. However, tags that you apply to the IAM role are always available.

column1: tags precedence in eks pod identity
column2: Tags added to the session through the sts:AssumeRole request take precedence in case of conflict. For example, if Amazon EKS adds a key eks-cluster-name and value my-cluster to the session when EKS assume the customer role, and you have also added an eks-cluster-name tag to the IAM role with value my-own-cluster, then the former takes precedence and the value for the eks-cluster-name tag will be my-cluster.
